contentrichtext.text: '''Zbigniew Lengren''' (1919 – 2003) was a [[Poland|Polish]] [[cartoonist]], [[caricaturist]], and [[illustrator]], of [[Swedish people|Swedish]] descent. He was awarded the "[[Order of Smile]]" amongst other, numerous awards. His most famous creation is Professor Filutek, who appeared once a week on the last page of ''[[Przekrój]]'' magazine, together with his dog Filus, for over 50 years, a record run in [[Poland|Polish]] [[comics]]. Lengren was also a writer, especially of poems for children. [[Image:Fafik.JPG|thumb|Monument to Filus guarding his master's belongings at the Old Town Market in [[Toruń]], Poland <ref>[http://www.torun4you.pl/zabytki/rynek-staromiejski.htm "Rynek Staromiejski (Rynek Główny) i Stare Miasto w Toruniu"]</ref>]] In 1947, whilst a Fine Arts student of the [[Nicolaus Copernicus University]], he won a competition to design the [[Bookplate|Super Ex Libris]] for the University Library. <ref> [http://www.bu.uni.torun.pl/en/super.htm Nicolaus Copernicus University Library super ex-libris], accessed on 10 June 2005</ref> The design is still in use today. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Lengren, Zbigniew | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =Cartoonist | DATE OF BIRTH = 1919 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 2003 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lengren, Zbigniew}} [[Category:1919 births]] [[Category:2003 deaths]] [[Category:20th-century Polish people]] [[Category:Polish cartoonists]] [[Category:Polish caricaturists]] [[Category:Polish illustrators]] [[Category:Polish people of Swedish descent]] [[Category:Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toruń alumni]] {{Poland-bio-stub}} {{Europe-comics-creator-stub}} {{illustrator-stub}}
